subject: Politics
title: Media and Public Opinion
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Media and Public Opinion.

hook.text: Fox News viewers and MSNBC viewers live in different realities. Same country, same facts, opposite conclusions.

buildup.text: Media shapes public opinion through repetition, emphasis, and the selection of experts and voices.

discovery.text: The 'cultivation theory' says heavy TV viewers adopt the worldview of the content they consume over time.

twist.text: People choose media that confirms their views. This 'selective exposure' creates echo chambers, not informed citizens.

climax.text: When citizens share no common facts, democratic debate becomes impossible. Agreement requires shared reality.

punchline.text: Media shapes what we believe. Choose your sources and you choose your reality.

quiz.question: What is 'selective exposure' in media consumption?
options: People choose media that confirms their existing beliefs
Viewers randomly select different news sources daily
